intro: Hieracium praecipuiforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium praecipuiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
